arm_group.description: therapy monitoring of patients with colo-rectal or stomach disease or with melanoma

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is the validation of MMS test to detect active tumor growth in
      different cancer types before and after therapy, as well as in the course of therapy and for
      subsequent relapse control compared to standard methods (clinical examination, imaging,
      tumor markers). It should be consider whether the MMS test has comparable diagnostic
      accuracy, and thus can replace more expensive or invasive procedures in future.

clinical_study.brief_title: Validation of MMS Test for Cancer Monitoring

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Clinical diagnosis of colo-rectal cancer

          -  Clinical diagnosis of stomach cancer

          -  Suspected diagnosis of melanoma

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Colitis ulcerosa

          -  Morbus Crohn

          -  Cancer in time period two years before

          -  Cancer therapy in time period two years before

study_pop.textblock: patients with primary diagnosis of cancer

facility.name: HELIOS Klinikum Berlin-Buch, Klinik für Interdisziplinäre Onkologie

clinical_study.official_title: Validation of MMS Test to Detect Active Tumor Growth of Different Cancer Types Before and After Therapy, as Well as for Subsequent Relapse Control in Comparison to Conventional Methods

primary_outcome.measure: active tumor growth before and after cancer therapy

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective
